title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description: Senior Infrastructure Engineer At Chexy, we're reimagining how Canadians manage their largest expenses—like rent, tuition, and insurance—by transforming them into opportunities to earn rewards, build credit, and gain financial flexibility. We're the first platform in Canada that lets users pay nearly any bill using their credit card, while unlocking meaningful benefits like cashback, points, and credit-building tools. With $1B+ in annual payment volume and millions of transactions per month, we're not just building software—we're building the infrastructure that moves real money for real people. About the Role We're looking for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to lead our infrastructure scaling efforts as we prepare for significant growth in transaction volume. You'll own critical infrastructure decisions and strengthen our security posture as we grow from processing $1B to $10B+ and beyond. This role involves designing and implementing the infrastructure foundation for Canada's next generation of financial services—systems that are compliant, secure, scalable, and built to handle high-stakes financial transactions. What You'll Be Doing • Design and implement infrastructure to support rapid growth in transaction volume while maintaining high reliability and performance • Architect and maintain PCI DSS 4.0 and SOC 2 Type II compliant infrastructure across all production systems • Own and optimize our Google Cloud Platform infrastructure including Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Cloud Deploy, BigQuery, and KMS • Manage and evolve our Terraform codebase for infrastructure provisioning and configuration management • Build and maintain observability systems using Datadog for application performance monitoring, infrastructure monitoring, and alerting • Lead security initiatives including encryption strategies, secret management, network security, audit trails, and compliance automation • Optimize infrastructure for performance, reliability, and cost efficiency at scale • Collaborate with backend engineers to deploy, monitor, and optimize the handling of Chexy's payment processing systems • Establish infrastructure best practices and mentor engineers on DevOps and cloud architecture Who We're Looking For • 5+ years of infrastructure/platform/DevOps engineering experience, with at least 3+ years of hands-on Google Cloud Platform experience • Deep expertise with GCP services including Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Cloud Deploy, KMS, and GCP networking • Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure provisioning and configuration management • Proven experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, CircleCI), containerization (Docker), and deployment automation • Experience with production observability tools like Datadog for APM, infrastructure monitoring, log aggregation, and alerting • Strong understanding of security practices including encryption, secrets management, IAM, network security, and compliance frameworks • Track record of building and maintaining high-volume, high-availability systems with strict SLAs • Experience with incident response, troubleshooting production issues, and writing clear postmortems • Ability to communicate technical decisions effectively to both engineering teams and leadership • Self-directed with strong ownership mentality and attention to reliability, security, and performance Bonus Points • Experience with financial systems, payment processing, or fintech infrastructure • PostgreSQL performance tuning and scaling (we use Cloud SQL + Prisma) • Redis optimization and caching strategies • Direct experience with PCI DSS or SOC 2 compliance initiatives • Contributions to open-source infrastructure projects • Experience with Vanta or similar compliance automation tools • Cloudflare configuration and optimization • NestJS or TypeScript microservices architecture Why Join Chexy? 💥 Build infrastructure that moves billions: Your work directly enables millions of dollars in rent payments and life-changing financial transactions for Canadians 💬 Join a tight-knit team: Work directly with founders and senior engineers who trust you to make critical decisions 📈 Early equity: Access equity in a high-growth fintech company that's just getting started 🛠 Own real impact: No bureaucracy, no endless meetings—just smart people solving hard problems together 📍 Toronto office: Work in-office 5 days a week with the team in Toronto How We Hire We keep our hiring process clear and human. You'll go through a mix of conversational interviews and technical deep-dives designed to showcase your strengths. We care about how you think, how you've solved real infrastructure problems, and how you collaborate—not just trivia questions. And we make sure there's space for your questions too. Chexy is an equal opportunity employer. If you require any accommodations or support during the hiring process, let us know and we'll do our best to help.
via: Startup Job Board - University Of Toronto

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description: Responsibilities: • Support and document IT infrastructure systems, ensuring stability and performance. • Comprehend and manage system architecture involving servers, databases, APIs, load balancers, firewalls, networking, and SAN. • Build, configure, and maintain virtualized environments using Hyper-V and/or VMware. • Administer Windows Server environments including patching, performance tuning, and security hardening. • Manage Active Directory (on-prem and Azure AD) and user provisioning tasks. • Design, implement, and own automation scripts using PowerShell and infrastructure-as-code tools like Ansible or Terraform. • Oversee backup processes at various levels—VM snapshots, OS-level, and SAN-level. • Monitor system health and performance using appropriate logging and monitoring tools; respond to incidents and perform triage effectively. • Use code management repositories (e.g., GitHub, Azure DevOps) for infrastructure configuration and deployment. • Contribute to SCRUM or Agile processes by delivering infrastructure-related tasks and improvements. • Lead projects from design to completion with minimal supervision and guide junior engineers through mentorship and knowledge-sharing. • Participate in on-call rotation and provide timely resolution to critical infrastructure issues. Qualifications: • 3+ years of experience in systems engineering or infrastructure management. • Strong understanding of IT system components: servers, databases, APIs, networking, firewalls, load balancers, SAN. • Proficiency in Windows Server administration, including patching and security best practices. • Hands-on experience with virtualization technologies such as Hyper-V and/or VMware. • Solid experience with Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. • Experience using and managing infrastructure with Ansible or Terraform. • Familiarity with scripting languages (PowerShell preferred); capable of reading, writing, and executing scripts. • Working knowledge of system monitoring tools and techniques. • Experience with backup technologies and methodologies. • Proficiency with code repositories like GitHub or Azure DevOps. • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to resolve complex technical issues. • Effective communicator and team collaborator within Agile/SCRUM environments. • Availability for on-call support as required. Benefits: • Paid Parental Leave • Flexible PTO • Certification(s) reimbursement • Summer Fridays • Extended Medical, Dental, Paid Sick Days, Vision, Life Insurance, and Disability Leave Coverage • RRSP & Employer match Equal Employment Opportunity: CARET is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. The compensation information below is provided in compliance with job posting disclosure requirements. Pay range: $163,000 – $200,000. Actual base pay will depend on varying circumstances, including the position, location, individual qualifications, market finances, and other operations business needs. Depending on the position, compensation may also include commission, bonuses, etc. Potential for bonuses is based on company performance and potential for merit increases is based on performance. #LI-Remote #LI-ST1

title: Senior Infra Engineer — Scale Fintech Cloud & Security
description: A fintech company is seeking a Senior Infrastructure Engineer in Toronto to lead critical infrastructure scaling efforts. Responsibilities include designing secure, scalable systems that handle high transaction volumes, managing Google Cloud infrastructure, and implementing security best practices. Ideal candidates should have extensive GCP experience and a strong DevOps background. This role offers a dynamic work environment focused on real impact in the financial services industry. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: 🔎 Skilled Systems Administrator Wanted! Our client, a rapidly growing healthcare technology company supporting clinics across Canada and the U.S., is seeking a Infrastructure Engineer to help strengthen and scale their IT operations. In this role, you'll take ownership of hybrid infrastructure spanning on-prem and cloud environments, ensuring performance, reliability, and automation at every level. From virtualization and networking to CI/CD and system monitoring, you'll play a key role in maintaining a secure, high-availability environment that supports critical business systems. 💻 Who You Are You're a versatile IT professional who thrives in complex environments and enjoys building resilient systems through automation. You bring a balance of hands-on technical skills, structured problem-solving, and a forward-thinking mindset. You're comfortable managing both legacy and modernized platforms, ensuring infrastructure runs smoothly, efficiently, and securely. 📍 Work Type • Fully Onsite - 5 days a week in office • Location: Vaughan, ON • Vacancy Type: This is a newly created position 🎯 What You'll Do (Your Superpowers) • Manage and maintain VMware, Proxmox, and Azure environments to ensure stability and scalability • Automate provisioning, configuration, and deployments using Ansible and related automation tools • Oversee server hardware, NAS, and backup solutions, ensuring redundancy and data protection • Configure and maintain pfSense, HAProxy, and Cisco networking devices for high availability and secure connectivity • Implement and maintain firewalls, VLANs, VPNs, and follow best practices for network and system security • Administer and optimize Linux and Windows servers, performing patching, tuning, and troubleshooting • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and improve infrastructure processes and standards • Deploy and manage Docker and Kubernetes environments, improving microservices performance and scalability • Monitor systems using Grafana, Prometheus, and Zabbix, setting up alerting and logging for proactive support • Manage and maintain MySQL, MongoDB, and SQLite databases with a focus on reliability, replication, and backup strategies • Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Git, integrating automation tools such as Terraform and Ansible ⭐ What We're Looking For (Our Wishlist) • 4+ years of hands-on experience in systems administration, DevOps, or infrastructure engineering • Strong understanding of Linux server administration (required), with experience managing Windows environments • Proven skills in virtualization platforms such as VMware and Proxmox • Solid networking foundation with experience configuring firewalls, VLANs, load balancers, and VPNs • Experience working in cloud environments (Azure preferred), including hybrid or multi-site architectures • Experience managing databases (MySQL, MongoDB, SQLite) for performance and reliability • Strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities with a focus on uptime, efficiency, and scalability • Excellent documentation, communication, and collaboration skills • A proactive mindset, always looking for opportunities to improve reliability and automate repetitive tasks Nice-to-Have: • Proficiency with automation and infrastructure-as-code tools such as Ansible and Terraform • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps toolchains (Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.) • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, and Zabbix 🔥 What Makes This Role Exciting • Innovation & Impact - Work across cutting-edge cloud, virtualization, and DevOps technologies to keep critical systems running efficiently • Autonomy & Ownership - Take the lead on infrastructure optimization, automation, and performance tuning projects • Continuous Learning - Expand your skills with modern tools and architectures across multiple environments • Collaborative Culture - Join a team that values curiosity, initiative, and innovation Benefits • Base Salary: $90,000 - $100,000 • Paid Time Off: Competitive vacation and personal days to maintain a healthy work-life balance • Health Spending Account & Dental Coverage: Flexible coverage to support your individual and family health needs • Culture & Team: Be a part of a supportive cross-functional team, that thrives on collaboration and innovation, where every member's ideas are valued and contribute to shared goals and success 📩 Ready to Elevate Your IT Career? Apply Now! At STACK IT Recruitment, we connect top technical talent with standout opportunities across Canada. If you meet at least 70% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply — we'd love to chat! Know someone perfect for this role? Share this posting! You might help them find their next great opportunity. ✨ We're proud to support diversity and inclusion. Need accommodation during the hiring process? Just let us know — we're here to help. AI Use Disclosure: STACK IT uses AI-enhanced tools to support initial candidate screening and interview note analysis. All assessments and hiring decisions remain human-led.

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer, Patching
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com What You’ll Be Doing You will be joining Infrastructure Engineering team within CIBC’s Infrastructure group as Sr. Infrastructure Engineer, Patching. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for designing a fully automated software patch solution which will be used to update software across an organization’s systems and applications. As an expert in IT Infrastructure, you will leverage your deep technical and business acumen, as well as leveraging all available capabilities including AI to provide valuable insights that drive automation, efficiencies, and agile transformation initiatives, ultimately enhancing our clients’ banking experience. At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview. How You’ll Succeed • Automate to drive efficiencies – Automate and implement patch deployment solutions using the most efficient tooling in order to reduce manual efforts and eliminate redundancies. • Embrace AI driven solutions – Explore and apply AI/ML technologies to enhance patch prioritization, predictive maintenance, and anomaly detection. Design Intelligent Dashboards and reporting systems that provide actionable insights into patch compliance and risk exposure. • Collaboration and leadership – Partner with platform owners, application operations and development teams, and IT leadership to align patch strategies with business needs. Mento junior engineers to promote a culture of automation, efficiency, and innovation within the Infrastructure Engineering team. • Metrics and reporting – Establish and meet KPIs for patch compliance, remediation timelines, and operational efficiency. Deliver clear, data-driven reports to IT leadership and stakeholders. Who You Are • You can demonstrate 5+ years' experience in IT Platform Engineering expertise with a view across disciplines to solve large problems. You also have proficiency in using patch management tools and software for automation and monitoring. • You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results. • You're passionate about efficiencies. You see existing processes as opportunities for improvement. • You embrace leading edge technologies. You have enthusiasm for leveraging emerging technologies (AI, predictive analytics) to transform Infrastructure Operations. • You have decision making and critical thinking skill. You have knowledge of tools and techniques for effective use of a broad range of factors, assumptions, frameworks and perspectives when solving problems. • Values matter to you - You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. #LI-TA What CIBC Offers At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck. • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a benefits program*, defined benefit pension plan*, an employee share purchase plan, a vacation offering, wellbeing support, and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program. • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients. • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development. • Subject to plan and program terms and conditions What you need to know • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit. • We may ask you to complete an attribute-based assessment and other skills tests (such as simulation, coding, French proficiency, MS Office). Our goal for the application process is to get to know more about you, all that you have to offer, and give you the opportunity to learn more about us. Job Location Toronto-81 Bay, 32nd Floor Employment Type Regular Weekly Hours 37.5 Skills Analytical Thinking, Infrastructure Management (IM), Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM), Qualys Vulnerability Management, Red Hat Ansible, Red Hat Satellite

title: Infrastructure & Capital Project - Electrical Engineer, COM
description: You’ve Never Been Satisfied with “Good Enough.” You want to make an impact, not just manage projects, but change how the world gets built. At Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects, you’ll do exactly that. You’ll help develop and deliver the factories, grids, transit systems, and public infrastructure that keep communities moving - and do it smarter, safer, and more sustainably than ever before. You’ll work alongside people who think big and act bold - project managers, engineers, technologists, and strategists who blend real-world experience with digital innovation and AI. Together, we’re transforming how capital projects are planned, managed, and executed, creating a better way to build for the future. Because “good enough” builds the past. You’re here to build what’s next, on a team that outperforms every norm. Visit us here to learn more about Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects • (Internal Title: Engineering VI) • Review and critically evaluate feasibility study deliverables relating to power supply, substation design, mine and plant power distribution, and electrical infrastructure • Provide Owner’s perspective and guidance on power supply options, interconnection studies, power balance, and electrical loads • Liaise with the local utility provider in Arizona to track and influence interconnection agreements, timelines, and permitting. • Support procurement strategies relating to electrical equipment and systems (transformers, switchgear, substations, overhead and underground distribution, etc.) • Act as the primary electrical engineering interface between the Owner and the EPC/M contractor • Review design packages and engineering deliverables prepared by the EPC/M to ensure compliance with project requirements, codes, and industry standards (NEC, IEEE, CSA, NESC, NFPA, as applicable)Provide independent technical review on electrical designs including substations, motor control centers, drives, power distribution, grounding, lighting, and control systems • Identify risks, gaps, or opportunities for value engineering and report findings to the Project Director • Monitor construction methodologies, quality control processes, and electrical installation works carried out by contractors • Participate in factory acceptance testing (FAT) and site acceptance testing (SAT) for major electrical equipment • Support commissioning planning and execution, ensuring electrical systems are fully tested, reliable, and safe for operation • Verify that electrical systems integrate effectively with plant control systems and meet project performance and reliability requirements • Provide troubleshooting expertise during ramp-up to resolve electrical reliability or performance issues • Document lessons learned for future projects and provide operational handover to owner’s operations and maintenance teams • Engage in the practice of professional engineering which: • Requires the application of engineering principles • Is an act of planning, designing, composing, evaluating, advising, reporting, supervising, or managing any of these acts • Involves the safeguarding of life, health, property, economic interests, the public welfare or the environment • Comply with regulations and guidelines for the practice of professional engineering in the State or Province of licensure including but not limited to professional responsibility, the Engineer’s duty to report, , due diligence, report writing, giving opinions, communications, confidential information, data gathering, and site investigations • Apply expert-level engineering knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to meet project requirements in the area of expertise • Implement and direct the specialty engineering services on the project from inception through to completion • Advise on the daily work and control the delivery of the project portfolio per project plans • Ensure goals are met including customer satisfaction, and engineering team member performance • Oversee the interface between client, consultants, and all associated service providers at all levels of the engagement model • Direct the implementation and management of changes and interventions to ensure engineering service goals are achieved on the project or program • Facilitate project focus and functional meetings for engineering initiatives • Manage senior-level customer relationships • Ensure there is a communication plan in place for meeting with stakeholders (including senior management and sponsors) to make the exchange of project-related information easy and transparent • Identify and analyze risks and implement mitigation strategies and contingency plans • Review and ensure adherence to the engineering services delivery plan, scope, schedule, milestones, budgets, and KPIs and address issues with corrective actions as appropriate • Control the delivery of functional engineering progress reports, proposals, and presentations to various audiences including the project team, senior executives, key stakeholders, and Comtech Operations • Evaluate and ensure the accurate interpretation of the functional scope of the assignment and manage and support any scope change negotiations • Set and adjust, if required, the functional engineering services expectations for the project or program while delegating and managing deliverables with the functional engineering team • Build and maintain a positive, high-performing team culture with an openness to constructive challenge, continuous improvement, implementation of lessons learned, and an overall ‘right-first-time” mindset • Nurture a project environment that is inclusive, and diverse and celebrates our differences • Clarify and resolve internal quality control checks and issues for the project • Working Conditions • Hybrid - The work location for this role will include a mix of working remotely, onsite at a client or in an Accenture office or center.

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer, defence ; Air, Maritime- National
description: Position: Senior Infrastructure Engineer, defence sector (Air, Maritime)- National Job Description Overview The Senior Infrastructure Engineer will join the Engineering Management practice within the Technical Professional Organization (TPO) of Engineering Services Canada. The Senior Infrastructure Engineer will play a lead role in the delivery of Engineering Services on large and complex projects within the Defence market portfolio. Your role • Reporting to the Director of Operations of the Engineering Management practice, the Senior Infrastructure Engineer lead the design, development, and oversight of critical infrastructure systems supporting Canada's defence operations. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure the resilience, security, and performance of infrastructure supporting military and defence technologies. • Lead the development of infrastructure strategies aligned with defence objectives, including facilities, networks, and operational support systems. • Provide expert guidance on engineering standards, risk assessments, and lifecycle management of infrastructure assets. • Manage large‑scale infrastructure projects, including design, procurement, implementation, and commissioning. • Ensure all infrastructure complies with Canadian defence regulations, cybersecurity standards, and environmental policies. • Liaise with the Department of National Defence (DND), Canadian Armed Forces (CAF), contractors, and other government agencies. • Drive modernization initiatives, including smart infrastructure, digital twins, and sustainable engineering practices. About you • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, or Systems Engineering. • 15 years of experience in infrastructure engineering, with at least 10 years in a defence or government context. • Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation in Canada. • Deep understanding of defence infrastructure requirements, including secure facilities, communications systems, and operational readiness. • Experience with project management methodologies (e.g., PMP) is an asset. • Security clearance (or eligibility) at the Secret level or higher. • Familiarity with NATO STANAGs, Canadian defence procurement processes, and DND infrastructure frameworks. • Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills. • Experience with digital infrastructure tools (e.g., BIM, GIS, SCADA). • This position requires knowledge of a language other than French, namely English, as the deliverables are intended for audiences located elsewhere in Canada or internationally. Reward & benefits Explore the rewards and benefits that help you thrive – at every stage of your life and your career at Atkins Réalis in Canada. Enjoy competitive compensation, employee recognition, and a brilliant range of flexible benefits you can tailor to your health, wellbeing, financial and lifestyle needs. Make the most of diverse opportunities for training and professional development to grow your skills and expertise. And take advantage of our hybrid working culture and generous time‑off policies to balance a fulfilling career with your personal life. About Atkins Réalis We're Atkins Réalis, a world‑class engineering services and nuclear organization. We connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. Together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. We're committed to leading our clients across our various end markets to engineer a better future for our planet and its people. Worker Type Employee Job Type Regular At Atkins Réalis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world‑class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Engineering Manager, Infrastructure
description: We are looking for an Engineering Manager - Infrastructure to join our Platform Infrastructure Group. Reporting to the Director of Engineering - Infrastructure, you will work closely with key technical partners across the organization to ensure that BenchSci’s development tooling, cloud infrastructure, and engineering practices can support our long-term growth, you will provide technical leadership across several areas within the team, lead complex projects, participate in roadmap and project planning, and actively contribute to BenchSci's technical roadmap. You Will: • Identify parts of our system and codebases that do not scale or meet reliability, performance, observability, and security requirements • Work with the infrastructure team to drive high-quality designs to improve and scale our infrastructure provisioning and CI/CD pipelines • Collaborate closely with the security and GRC teams to ensure that our cloud configuration has adequate security controls, and meets contractual and compliance requirements • Develop and exercise disaster recovery plans and improve those capabilities. • Partner with various engineering teams and identify opportunities to improve our development tooling, frameworks, and infrastructure • Partner closely with other Staff Engineers, Engineering Managers, and Directors to devise and refine requirements to create development tooling, and build systems and services that accelerate the velocity of our engineers • Lead software and system design initiatives by leveraging cloud-native design patterns and injecting your cloud expertise into the entire development lifecycle You Have: • 4-5 years of experience in a similar role in a SaaS or similar industry • In-depth experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) • Experience developing, maintaining, and scaling CI/CD pipelines • Experience developing, maintaining, and scaling build tools for supporting large monorepo codebases and service-oriented architectures. • Working knowledge of infrastructure-as-code solutions such as Terraform or KCC • A deep understanding of containerization, and extensive experience with Docker and Kubernetes • Expert knowledge of observability tools and techniques in a cloud-native environment • Experience working with Python, Javascript, or similar programming languages. • Experience as a People Manager is a mustBenefits and Perks: • A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options • A robust vacation policy plus an additional vacation day every year • Company closures for 14 more days throughout the year • Flex time for sick days, personal days, and religious holidays • Comprehensive health and dental benefits • Annual learning & development budget • A one-time home office set-up budget to use upon joining BenchSci • An annual lifestyle spending account allowance • Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options • The ability to save for your retirement coupled with a company match! About BenchSci: BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at top pharmaceutical companies and leading academic centers. Our Culture: Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning. We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement. You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives. Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

title: Senior Infrastructure Resiliency Engineer
description: Job Description What is the Opportunity? The Disaster Recovery and BCM team within the Data Centres and Operational Resiliency department is responsible to support RBC’s critical business processes by ensuring technology is prepared to recover from the unexpected. As a Senior Infrastructure Resiliency Engineer you will be responsible for assessing disaster readiness and overall application resiliency based on critical risks. You will refine guidelines for resiliency and disaster readiness, review DR plans and recommend architecture improvements to mitigate risk and remove single points of failure. You will be part of an important program of continuous improvement that ensures the ongoing resilience of RBC as we become a digitally enabled relationship bank. What will you do? • Assess critical business processes from an end-to-end viewpoint in order to identify Resiliency risks and recommend technology and process changes. • Align DR Guidelines with Global Risk Standards and participate in Change Management to ensure compliance. • Partner with the Infrastructure Architecture and Platform teams to continually update design patterns to ensure the use of the latest technological advancements. • Participate with the Disaster Recovery team on exercises and contribute recommendations on continuous improvement. • Partner with the ITSM team to monitor Incident and Problem tickets and participate in root cause analysis to specify Resiliency or DR factors. • Research and remain current on multiple technology platforms. What do you need to succeed? Must-have • Senior operational experience (on-call break-fix) with either Windows or Linux, and a functional understanding of both. • Good experience with resiliency design including clusters, high availability and failover. • Good experience with Disaster Recovery including design, exercise planning and execution. • Good understanding of IT infrastructure including virtualization, databases, SAN and NAS storage, messaging, networking and Cloud. Nice to have: • Scripting and automation using Ansible or similar tools. • Experience with ServiceNow. • Familiarity with multi-tier application design. What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable. • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities. • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact. • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team. • A world-class training program in financial services. • Opportunities to do challenging work. #LI-POST #TECHPJ Job Skills Adaptability, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Detail-Oriented, Industry Knowledge, Information Technology (IT) Systems Support, Information Technology Operations, Information Technology Trends, IT Disaster Recovery, IT Infrastructure Architecture, Risk Management, Technology Platforms, Time Management Additional Job Details Address: RBC CENTRE, 155 WELLINGTON ST W:TORONTO City: Toronto Country: Canada Work hours/week: 37.5 Employment Type: Full time Platform: TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS Job Type: Regular Pay Type: Salaried Posted Date: 2025-10-15 Application Deadline: 2025-11-28 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities. Ability to make a difference and lasting impact. Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team. A world-class training program in financial services. Opportunities to do challenging work. Adaptability, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Detail-Oriented, Industry Knowledge, Information Technology (IT) Systems Support, Information Technology Operations, Information Technology Trends, IT Disaster Recovery, IT Infrastructure Architecture, Risk Management, Technology Platforms, Time Management Additional Job DetailsRBC CENTRE, 155 WELLINGTON ST W:TORONTOTECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONSNote: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. title: Principal Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description: About Home.CA We’re building Canada’s #1 Home Ecosystem, reimagining the end-to-end homeownership experience for millions of Canadians, making it simple and rewarding. The Role We're seeking an exceptionally dedicated Principal Cloud Infrastructure Engineer who thrives on building production-grade cloud systems that deliver real-world value to Canadian homeowners. This isn't a role for someone looking for routine infrastructure maintenance—this is for an engineer passionate about architecting resilient, scalable platforms that power innovative experiences. Every service you deploy, and optimization you make, will directly impact thousands of homeowners making critical financial decisions. In our startup environment, your impact is immediate and unmediated—you aren't just maintaining a platform, you're defining the technical trajectory of the business. Your work will enable real-time insights, intelligent chat interactions, and data-driven home management tools that people depend on daily. What You'll Build Cloud Infrastructure - Design and operate production cloud infrastructure for our microservices platform - Manage AI/ML service deployments for intelligent chat agents and semantic search capabilities - Architect NoSQL database solutions for real-time data synchronization and scalability - Implement and optimize vector search infrastructure for semantic data retrieval - Oversee deployment pipelines across environments Microservices Architecture - Support and evolve our polyglot microservice ecosystem - Manage service mesh, API gateway, and inter-service communication patterns - Architect high-availability patterns for our services CI/CD & DevOps - Enhance our pipelines with advanced deployment strategies - Implement comprehensive monitoring - Design automated rollback mechanisms - Play a strategic role in cooperation with engineering teams to establish observability across all services Security & Compliance - Manage authentication infrastructure and service-to-service authentication - Implement data residency and privacy controls compliant with Canadian laws - Secure secrets management, service account permissions, and network policies - Design disaster recovery and backup strategies for distributed data systems Performance & Scale - Optimize container resource allocation, auto-scaling policies, and cost efficiency - Design caching strategies for high-throughput data access patterns - Monitor and improve p95/p99 latencies for real-time user interactions - Plan capacity for significant platform growth and geographic expansion Your Profile Required Technical Depth - 8+ years architecting production cloud infrastructure at scale - Expert-level knowledge of Kubernetes and container orchestration platforms - Production expertise with NoSQL databases (Firestore, MongoDB, DynamoDB, etc) and distributed data systems - Mastery of Terraform or similar infrastructure-as-code tools - Strong understanding of Spring Boot, Node.js, and polyglot microservice architectures - Advanced knowledge of networking, load balancing, and CDN optimization Essential Qualities - Relentless dedication: You're driven by the idea that every infrastructure decision impacts real people's lives - Real-world impact focus: You measure success by system uptime, user experience, and business outcomes—not just technical elegance - Production-first mindset: You think about failure modes, rollback plans, and 3am incident response before deploying - Canadian regulatory awareness: Understanding of data sovereignty, privacy laws, and compliance requirements - Passion for AI/ML infrastructure: Excited about enabling intelligent agents, semantic search, and generative AI workflows Essential Skills Cloud Platforms: Google Cloud Platform (GKE, Cloud Run, Cloud Build) Compute: Kubernetes, serverless platforms, container orchestration AI/ML: Vertex AI (RAG Engine, Vector Search), LangChain, LangGraph Databases: NoSQL (Firestore, MongoDB), PostgreSQL Backend: Node.js (TypeScript, Fastify), Spring Boot (Java) Frontend: Angular deployment patterns Auth: Firebase Auth, OAuth2/JWT DevOps: GitHub Actions, Terraform, Docker, Gradle, npm Monitoring: Cloud monitoring, tracing, structured logging Domain: Financial services, home services, property management Operating Systems: Linux and Windows administration What Makes This Role Exceptional 1. Direct Impact: Your infrastructure powers AI-driven insights—every optimization directly improves user value 2. Cutting-Edge AI: Work with production-grade AI/ML services including generative models and intelligent agents 3. Architectural Influence: Shape a diverse polyglot microservices architecture spanning multiple ecosystems 4. Scale Challenge: Build for rapid scaling and broad geographic expansion 5. Modern Stack: Work with cutting-edge cloud services, Kubernetes patterns, and AI/ML tools 6. AI-Enabled Engineering: Our development practices leverage advanced AI tools to accelerate every stage of engineering 7. Ownership: Lead major infrastructure initiatives end-to-end, from design to production Location & Work Style Hybrid role based in North York, open to residents of the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). We operate with a flexible hybrid model requiring up to 3 days a week in the office for high-bandwidth collaboration. You must be extremely self-directed and passionate about working on systems where your contributions have tangible, real-world value. If you're an infrastructure engineer who wants every deployment to matter, every optimization to improve real lives, and every architectural decision to enable groundbreaking AI experiences—this is your role. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00-$120,000.00 per year Benefits: • Casual dress • Company events • Flexible schedule • Work from home Ability to commute/relocate: • North York, ON M2N 5Y7: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) Experience: • Cloud infrastructure: 8 years (required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in North York, ON M2N 5Y7

title: Cloud Automation Engineer
description: Key Responsibilities: • Design, build, and maintain automation solutions for cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, or GCP. • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM Templates, or Pulumi. • Automate cloud provisioning, configuration, deployments, and scaling using scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell. • Create CI/CD pipelines to automate application deployments using Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, or Azure DevOps. • Implement automated monitoring, alerting, and logging solutions for cloud environments. • Collaborate with cloud architects, DevOps, and engineering teams to define automation standards and best practices. • Optimize cloud resources to improve performance, cost efficiency, and reliability. • Manage containerization and orchestration platforms such as Docker, Kubernetes, or OpenShift. • Enhance and maintain automation for security compliance, including IAM roles, policies, access controls, and vulnerability mitigation. • Troubleshoot automation failures, deployment issues, and cloud infrastructure incidents. • Develop reusable automation scripts, modules, and templates to standardize cloud operations. • Maintain clear documentation of automation workflows, architectural diagrams, and runbooks. • Support cloud migration, modernization, and infrastructure transformation projects. Required Skills & Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field. • Strong experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud services and their automation capabilities. • Proficiency in Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM Templates, or other IaC tools. • Solid scripting knowledge in Python, Bash, or PowerShell for automation tasks. • Experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control (Git), and automated deployment pipelines. • Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, or OpenShift for container orchestration. • Strong understanding of cloud networking: VPCs, subnets, load balancers, DNS, firewall rules, routing, etc. • Experience with monitoring tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, New Relic, or ELK Stack. • Knowledge of cloud security best practices, identity management (IAM), and compliance standards. • Solid understanding of distributed systems, microservices, and cloud-native architectures. • Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills. • Strong communication and ability to collaborate in Agile environments. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00-$120,000.00 per year Work Location: In person

title: Google Cloud Engineer
description: Key Responsibilities: • Design, deploy, and manage scalable cloud solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). • Build and optimize cloud architectures using services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Run, GKE, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub, BigQuery, and Cloud Storage. • Automate infrastructure provisioning using Terraform, Deployment Manager, or Ansible. • Configure and manage Kubernetes clusters using GKE for containerized applications. • Implement CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Cloud Build, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI. • Monitor cloud performance and cost optimization using Cloud Monitoring, Cloud Logging, and Cost Management tools. • Ensure cloud security best practices including IAM roles, VPC configurations, firewall rules, encryption, and secret management. • Support cloud migration strategies, including lift-and-shift and modernization initiatives. • Troubleshoot cloud infrastructure issues and provide timely resolution. • Collaborate with development, DevOps, and security teams to enhance cloud-native solutions. • Maintain documentation for system architecture, workflows, and configurations. Required Skills & Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. • 3+ years of hands-on experience working with Google Cloud Platform. • Strong proficiency in GCP services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Functions, GKE, BigQuery, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, and Cloud Storage. • Experience with Terraform, Deployment Manager, or other infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools. • Good understanding of networking concepts: VPC, VPN, subnets, firewalls, load balancers, DNS. • Experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, GKE). • Proficiency in scripting using Python, Bash, or PowerShell. • Practical knowledge of CI/CD concepts and pipeline tools. • Strong understanding of cloud security, IAM, and best compliance practices. • Excellent problem-solving, troubleshooting, and communication skills. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60,000.00-$130,000.00 per year Work Location: In person

title: GCP Cloud Engineer/Architect
description: Title: GCP Cloud Engineer/Architect Location: Toronto , Ontario Remote Duration: 6 Months Introduction We are seeking a Service Reliability Automation Engineer with expertise in automating system operations and improving reliability. The role involves working with tools like ServiceNow, Dynatrace, databases, and batch technologies such as Informatica and Control-M. Required Skills & Qualifications • Expertise in Ansible and Python for automation • Proficiency in Python and Shell scripting • Experience with ServiceNow, Dynatrace, and other monitoring tools like AIOps, Datadog, Splunk • Knowledge of Informatica and Control-M • Experience with CI/CD and DevOps practices • Experience in Power Automate, Power BI tools Preferred Skills & Qualifications • Experience with Terraform for infrastructure configuration • Experience in automating integrations with tools like SolarWinds Day-to-Day Responsibilities • Build and maintain automation frameworks using Ansible and Python to streamline operational processes • Automate integrations with tools like ServiceNow, Dynatrace, and SolarWinds for incident management and monitoring • Automate batch processes using tools like Informatica and Control-M to enhance efficiency and reliability • Implement automated monitoring and alert systems using tools like Dynatrace and Splunk • Use Ansible and Terraform for infrastructure configuration and automation across environments Company Benefits & Culture • Committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment • Opportunities for professional development and growth • Supportive and collaborative team atmosphere For immediate consideration please click APPLY to begin the screening process with Alex.

title: Cloud Engineer - Enterprise AI Services/Big Data
description: Overview: We are seeking a driven and talented Cloud Engineer to join our growing Enterprise AI Services team in Platform Engineering. As a Cloud Engineer, Enterprise AI Services/Big Data reporting to our Enterprise AI Services Senior Manager, you will be instrumental in designing, building, and maintaining the cloud infrastructure that powers our cutting-edge AI solutions for enterprise clients. This is an opportunity to work with leading-edge technologies in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. About the Role: • Leverage your strong C# programming skills to design, develop, and implement highly scalable, resilient, and secure Enterprise AI Services. This includes building foundational components for Agentic AI, LLM orchestration, and intelligent automation. • Work closely with Enterprise AI Services and Big Data technical teams and architects to establish and deliver Cloud/SaaS based technologies and services including Azure Open AI, AWS Bedrock, Azure API Management, Google Cloud APIGEE, Snowflake, Power BI and other emerging technologies to Thomson Reuters product teams. • Partner with product development teams to implement best practices and optimize performance of the Enterprise AI and Cloud applications • Participate in the analysis of new SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS services, then develop automation and solutions to support using them at enterprise scale • Manage cloud service product/feature upgrades, including testing and release planning • Research new AI and Cloud technologies and assess maturity and alignment of the technology to business and technology strategy. Collaborate with vendors on previewing technologies. • Evaluate and incorporate enterprise-grade security features as standard components of the service offerings we produce, in alignment with Thomson Reuters information security team • Prepare and present high quality technical and non-technical documentation • Communicate in a professional manner when interacting across staff levels and internal customers • Evaluate and communicate risk as a top consideration for all solutions and changes being made on behalf customers About You: You’re a fit for the role of Cloud Engineer, Enterprise AI Services/Big Data, if you have • B.S./B.A. Computer Science or related field; or equivalent level of experience • C# Programming Language required. • Demonstrated use of Python and/or SQL is an asset • Previous Software or Cloud engineering and development experience required • Snowflake experience heavily preferred, including Stored Procedures and administrative functions. • AWS Cloud experience (highly recommended, Cloud Practitioner and higher AWS certification preferred) • Azure Cloud experience (highly recommended, AZ-900 or AI-900 and higher Azure certification preferred) • Google Cloud experience (APIGEE preferred) • Understanding of cloud infrastructure. Understanding of non-relational database and search technologies. Understanding of vector capabilities and other AI functions. • Demonstrated use of CI/CD technologies is a plus, • Understanding of tools like Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitHub Actions, JFrog Artifactory, Docker preferred. • Strong passion for technology and a willingness to learn new skills and use new technologies like AI coding assistants like GitHub Co-Pilot or Claude Code. • Self-motivation and self-direction, ability to translate technical direction and apply to specific work responsibilities • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams across global time zones. • Ability to investigate complex issues spanning multiple technologies • Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills #LI-MW1 What’s in it For You? • Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected. • Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance. • Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future. • Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing. • Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together. • Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives. • Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world. About Us Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news. We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace. We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here. Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com

title: Cloud Engineer
description: Responsibilities • Design and develop cloud architecture solutions utilizing platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure, OpenStack, Rackspace, and VMware. • Implement and manage virtualization technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, VMware, and OpenStack to optimize resource utilization. • Develop automation scripts and configuration management using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, PowerShell, Bash scripting, and Shell Scripting to streamline deployment processes. • Maintain and enhance cloud infrastructure security through system hardening and best practices for system management. • Build and support web services and APIs using RESTful architecture for SaaS, PaaS, IaaS environments. • Collaborate with software development teams to facilitate application deployment using CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins, Git, and other DevOps tools. • Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues related to cloud infrastructure components such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle databases, NoSQL databases like MongoDB or DynamoDB. • Ensure high availability and disaster recovery planning for cloud-based systems. • Support the integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices within the cloud environment when applicable. Requirements • Proven experience in designing and managing cloud architectures across multiple platforms including AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure, VMware, OpenStack, Rackspace. • Strong knowledge of virtualization technologies such as Docker containers, Kubernetes orchestration, VMware vSphere/ESXi. • Proficiency in scripting languages including Python, Ruby, PowerShell, Bash (Unix shell), Shell Scripting for automation tasks. • Hands-on experience with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet for infrastructure automation. • Familiarity with web services development using RESTful APIs and microservices architecture. • Understanding of operating systems including Linux (Ubuntu/CentOS), Windows Server environments. • Knowledge of database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle SQL Server; experience with NoSQL databases is a plus. • Experience with DevOps practices including CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins or similar tools. • Strong understanding of network security principles including VPNs and system hardening techniques. • Familiarity with cloud development frameworks such as Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC). • Excellent problem-solving skills combined with the ability to work collaboratively in an Agile environment. This position offers an opportunity to work at the forefront of cloud technology innovation within a dynamic organization committed to excellence in IT infrastructure development and deployment. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00-$120,000.00 per year

title: Cloud Engineer
description: It's no secret that traditional site reliability teams struggle to keep pace with manual monitoring, reactive troubleshooting, and labor-intensive deployments. The rise of AI presents a solution, but many companies fail to fully leverage its potential, resulting in systems that underperform and bottlenecks that stifle innovation. Data shows that 73% of companies struggle with deployment delays and operational downtime, primarily due to outdated processes and lack of AI-driven automation. At IgniteTech, we are tackling these issues head-on by building AI-first cloud solutions that are designed to anticipate and prevent problems before they arise. We focus on integrating AI and machine learning into every facet of cloud infrastructure management, from automated monitoring systems to intelligent CI/CD pipelines. This approach creates environments that not only self-heal but also continuously evolve, reducing downtime, improving performance, and pushing the boundaries of what cloud services can do. This isn’t your typical site reliability role, where you'd be reacting to problems and manually intervening when things go wrong. Here, you’ll lead the charge in building AI-enhanced monitoring systems that detect and resolve 95% of issues before they ever reach end users. You’ll also architect and manage AI-automated CI/CD pipelines that reduce deployment times by 30% while slashing manual interventions. The ideal candidate thrives in an AI-driven environment, is excited by the prospect of automation-first solutions, and enjoys pushing the envelope of cloud infrastructure design. In this role, you’ll join a global team of innovators who are redefining cloud infrastructure. Your work will play a key role in our mission to deliver next-gen, AI-driven operational excellence. We’re seeking someone who is passionate about AI and ready to make a lasting impact on the future of cloud services. If that’s you, we encourage you to apply and be part of something revolutionary. What you will be doing • Implementing AI-based monitoring services to automatically detect, predict, and resolve issues before they impact operations • Managing CI/CD pipelines with AI-driven automation to enhance deployment efficiency and reduce manual intervention What you won’t be doing • Focusing solely on manual monitoring, troubleshooting, and maintenance of systems; your goal will be to get AI to do these things for you AI-First Site Reliability Engineer key responsibilities • Achieve seamless scalability and optimize performance for AI-powered cloud services, ensuring 99.99% uptime while delivering AI-enhanced software upgrades and customizations that meet clients' evolving needs Basic Requirements • AI-First Mindset (if your instinct is to write code first and then use AI tools to verify or enhance your code, rather than the other way around, then please do not apply) • At least 3 years of DevOps experience, including automation of CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure management • At least 2 years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) • Proficiency in AI and machine learning tools used for monitoring, automation, and predictive analytics (or strong willingness to learn and adapt to AI-driven technologies) • Strong programming and scripting skills, with experience in automating tasks and building AI-driven processes About IgniteTech World-class talent. 100% global remote. Ready to be a part of the top talent that IgniteTech has curated from thousands of applicants throughout the world? Come join us. Through our portfolio of leading enterprise software solutions, we ignite business performance for thousands of customers globally. We’re big believers in the remote-work-from-anywhere lifestyle, which creates freedom for our team members and enables us to hire the best and brightest from around the world. A career with IgniteTech is challenging and fast-paced and we’re always looking for energetic and enthusiastic team members. We’re an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity employer and we value the strength that diversity brings to our workplace.

title: Staff Cloud Engineer
description: Job Description What is the Opportunity? Excited about cloud technologies? Looking to make a difference helping one of the biggest enterprises in Canada build and scale hybrid cloud? We need your help! At RBC, we build products on top of our cloud platforms to enable application teams to leverage platform capabilities and increase developer productivity. In this role, you will design and build scalable and resilient delivery and deployment systems on various cloud platforms that will enhance developer experience from onboarding to deployment to production. What will you do? • Design, develop, configure and maintain cloud-native application delivery solutions to address business requirements • Evaluate and troubleshoot system operations, providing solutions to optimize complex systems • Collaborate with a team of fellow engineers in building large scale solutions across public and private clouds • Create technical and product documentation for your solutions and the platform • Continuously learn new technical skills and practice by applying them in your day-to-day work • Support high profile customers to migrate their applications to RBC’s Kubernetes platforms Primary responsibilities: Design and implement highly available, scalable, and resilient systems and components for a cloud native technology stack • Develops detailed plans and accurate estimates for the design, build, implementation and stabilization of features and systems • Manages all aspects of testing and verification ensuring all tasks are completed Actively participates in defining, planning and executing team activities, such as providing recommendations for engineering and process improvements • Recommends strategies to enhance developer experience, platform engineering and operations, and team planning activities • Collaborates with teammates and peers to plan, build and maintain high quality technical solutions Responsible for configuration, maintenance, release and troubleshooting Kubernetes workload delivery technology and tools. • Manages CI/CD for platform components and continuous delivery system for applications • Ensures cloud system applications meet high quality standards • Manages day-to-day administration activities, including but not limited to performance tuning/scaling Support and provide guidance to high profile application teams to migrate applications to the cloud in face-paced environment. • Provides guidance on transforming into cloud native application using platform tools. Must-have • Experience developing software, with proficiency in high level programming languages, ideally Go • Experience with RESTful APIs • Experience with containerization technologies like Docker • Experience with Kubernetes • Knowledge of CI/CD and DevOps best practices • Effective communication skills and a learning attitude Nice-to-have • Experience with industry standard CI/CD tooling and cloud native technologies • Experience creating and manipulating YAML files • Experience working with Azure, AWS cloud and/or Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform • Experience working in an Agile development environment What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team • A world-class training program in financial services • Flexible work/life balance options • Opportunities to do challenging work • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients #LI-POST #TECHPJ Job Skills Agile Scrum Development, Cloud Computing Architecture, Cloud Platform, Cloud Technology, Computer Programming, Computer Software, Containerization, Continuous Delivery, Design, DevOps, Go Programming Language, Infrastructure As Code (IaC), Kubernetes, Systems Software, Teamwork Additional Job Details Address: 330 FRONT ST W:TORONTO City: Toronto Country: Canada Work hours/week: 37.5 Employment Type: Full time Platform: TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS Job Type: Regular Pay Type: Salaried Posted Date: 2025-07-22 Application Deadline: 2026-01-12 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description: Application Deadline: 12/30/2025 Address: 33 Dundas Street West Job Family Group: Technology We are seeking an enthusiastic, passionate professional for a Cloud Engineering position with extensive experience with AWS cloud services. BMO’s cloud strategy is focused on innovation, leveraging rapidly emerging cloud native services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of our customers. The BMO Cloud Engineering team is leading the way at a Bank where our Purpose is Growing The Good and Being Bold. We demonstrate those values every day. Be part of the action – where we have challenging discussions about how to align those customer requirements to the right cloud architectures and services. Help evolve the BMO’s core cloud platform, leveraging emerging best practices and tools, securely connected to our strategic suppliers, providing a platform for innovation to an entire Bank. Responsibilities: Working in a close-knit technical team, the role will: • Design and implement BMO Cloud Platform, core and shared services • Drive holistic design & patterns for secure cloud application environments, Cloud platform enhancements, data services, and cloud service integrations • Partner with other stakeholders to drive the creation of Cloud migration & transformation strategy and infrastructure roadmaps across application, information, business and technology landscapes • Develop patterns for automated provisioning, management, scalability and security • Ensure that all cloud solutions follow internally defined security and compliance standards and controls • Design and plan enterprise-scale cloud environments including application dependencies, data storage and flow, network connectivity and overall cloud hosting • Design, implement and secure cloud IaaS, PaaS and higher services in AWS • Develop and maintain up-to-date architectural templates, build and operational documentation of the technical environment • Work in close collaboration with the rest of Engineering, DevOps and CIO teams to develop Service Catalogues • Continuously enhance the capability, security and experience of the enterprise cloud Required Core Skills: • Understanding of cloud design patterns, Cloud Native principles, cloud operations and cloud security models • Strong programming skills and fluency with at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Bash, PowerShell • Strong Knowledge and proven experience in setting up, securing and managing public cloud infrastructure • Demonstrated knowledge of cloud provisioning and administration, cloud interoperability, cloud disaster recovery and business continuity strategies, as well as performance measurement and monitoring in the cloud • Proficiency in cloud automation using AWS CLI, Azure CLI, CDK, CloudFormation, ARM or terraform. • Hands-on experience with system configuration and DevOps tools preferably Ansible, Bitbucket, Git, Jira and Confluence • Experience and knowledge of running containers and containers infrastructure in the cloud on a large scale • Experience working on Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), AWS Fargate, Elastic Container Service (ECS) • Experience working on Lambda, API Gateway, Kinesis Data Stream, SNS, SQS, DynamoDB • Ability to participate in and keep up with fast-paced DevOps and System Engineering teams within Agile processes • Experience with AI concepts, GenAI, prompt engineering, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), AI-powered tools in SDLC etc Other Skills: • Strong interpersonal and communication Skills • A critical thinker with strong research and analytics skills • Self-motivated with a positive attitude and an ability to work independently and/or in a team • Able to work under tight timelines and deliver on complex problems Salary: $75,900.00 - $141,900.00 Pay Type: Salaried The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type. Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position. BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards About Us At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en. BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.
