title: Azure Cloud Engineer
description: Your new company Join a mission-driven organization dedicated to delivering innovative technology solutions that support impactful initiatives. You’ll be part of a collaborative team focused on leveraging cloud technologies to drive efficiency and scalability. Your new role As an Azure Solutions Developer, you will design and build secure, performant, and scalable serverless data applications in the Azure cloud. You’ll architect solutions using Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and modern integration patterns, ensuring compliance with security and regulatory standards. Key responsibilities include: • Architect and implement serverless applications using Azure Functions and Logic Apps. • Design secure authentication and authorization flows with Microsoft Entra ID (OAuth 2.0). • Develop RESTful APIs for integration and data exchange. • Configure real-time data synchronization between multiple Salesforce instances. • Implement monitoring, logging, and performance optimization for serverless workflows. • Apply best practices for secure API development and OAuth token management. What you'll need to succeed • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. • 5+ years of experience in application development and integration using Azure services. • Proven expertise in serverless architectures, OAuth-based authentication, and REST API development. • Hands-on experience with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and event-driven data pipelines. • Proficiency in Microsoft Entra ID (OAuth 2.0) for secure authentication. Experience integrating Salesforce using APIs and real-time sync mechanisms. • Familiarity with Azure monitoring tools, cloud security best practices, and DevOps deployment automation. What you'll get in return • Opportunity to work on impactful projects leveraging cutting-edge Azure technologies. • A collaborative and inclusive work environment. • Competitive compensation and benefits package. What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. This posting is not for an existing vacancy with the organization. AI may be used to screen, assess or select applicants for the position. #LI-DNI #1122498 - Blake Robinson

title: Cloud Platform Engineer – AWS
description: Cloud Platform Engineer – AWS Apex Systems is a global IT services provider, and our staffing practice has an opening for a Cloud Platform Engineer with extensive programming abilities with Python, Typescript or NodeJS, an in-depth cloud background with AWS, and DevOps experience to place at our client, a Big Five Bank. Client: Big Five Bank Terms: Contract through October 2026. Location: Hybrid twice a month is preferred with an office in Downtown Toronto. however open to remote for the right candidate with EST working hours. Project: • The Bank is seeking a Cloud Platform Engineer to support the Bank’s cloud strategy, which is focused on innovation and leveraging rapidly emerging cloud native services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of their customers. • The Cloud DevOps Automation Team is focused on the implementation, deployment, and maintenance of the core Cloud Platforms across the Bank. • The Cloud Platform Engineer will help evolve the core cloud platform, by leveraging emerging best practices and tools, securely connecting to our strategic cloud suppliers, providing a platform for innovation for the entire Bank. Job Description:Design, implement and integrate the bank’s Cloud Platform, core, and shared services. • Design, implement and manage hybrid cloud connectivity and intra-cloud networking. • Develop patterns for automated provisioning, management, scalability, and security. • Ensure that all cloud solutions follow internally defined security and compliance standards and controls. • Be the major contributor to IaC modules: develop new modules, maintain existing modules. • Design and plan enterprise-scale cloud environments including application dependencies, data storage and flow, network connectivity and overall cloud hosting. • Develop and maintain up-to-date architectural templates, build an operational documentation of the technical environment. • Continuously enhance the capability, security, and experience of the enterprise Hybrid cloud. Technical Requirements: • Extensive experience in the following tools and technologies: • Typescript • NodeJS • Python • AWS CDK • Terraform • Cloud Formation • CICD • Open Policy Agent/Policy as Code • Container – EKS – Kubernetes – ECS – Docker • Azure DevOps pipeline design and architecture • Github Actions • CircleCI • Jenkins • Agile Framework • Linux • Extensive cloud platform experience and skills: • Certifications in AWS and/or Azure. • DynomoDB • ECS • Lambda – Serverless • Step Functions • Cognito • API Gateway • IAM • Azure DevOps • WebApp • AKS • ACI • Key Vault • SQL MI Interview Process: Interviews will take place in two rounds with a technical screening component. • This is a great opportunity to join a Big Five Bank and continue your career in the financial domain. Be a part of a great work environment with a very well-organized team and colleagues who will help you succeed.
